q: To be in harmony with the wholeness of things is not to have anxiety over imperfections.
h:
“To be in harmony with the wholeness of things is not to have anxiety over imperfections.” —
Dogen

q: Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.
h:
“Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.” —
Soren Kierkegaard

q: Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths.
h:
“Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths.” —
Charles Spurgeon

q: If you are depressed, you are living in the past. If you are anxious, you are living in the future. if you are at peace, you are living in the present.
h:
“If you are depressed, you are living in the past. If you are anxious, you are living in the future. if you are at peace, you are living in the present.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Men are anxious to improve their circumstances but are unwilling to improve themselves; they therefore remain bound.
h:
“Men are anxious to improve their circumstances but are unwilling to improve themselves; they therefore remain bound.” —
James Allen

q: The secret of perfect health lies in keeping the mind always cheerful - never worried, never hurried, never borne down by any fear, thought or anxiety.
h:
“The secret of perfect health lies in keeping the mind always cheerful - never worried, never hurried, never borne down by any fear, thought or anxiety.” —
Sathya Sai Baba
